intro: Caralluma truncatocoronata var. geniculata, commonly known as the Indian date cactus, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of India and Pakistan. It features a branching structure with cylindrical stems that are often ribbed and covered in small, spiny tubercles. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, followed by fruit that resembles a date in appearance and taste. It is well adapted to hot, dry climates and can store water in its thick stems. This species is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
